R.content: annulment of time announced in date, revolution, volt of the ring (anneau), il faut le temps, default, failure, collapse [autos needing other, event, time, heteronomy]
R.linkedContent: annulment of time announced in date, revolution, volt of the ring (anneau), il faut le temps, default, failure, collapse [autos needing other, event, time, heteronomy]

OH.content: in the dated nature of dating, of currentness, lies a disquieting wrinkle, stigmata of anachrony marking all our days > traditional discourse of modernity, discourse of anamnesis w/ its goût de fin, if not for death
OH.linkedContent: in the dated nature of dating, of currentness, lies a disquieting wrinkle, stigmata of anachrony marking all our days > traditional discourse of modernity, discourse of anamnesis w/ its goût de fin, if not for death

S.content: the becoming-crepuscular (Dämmerung) is not a decline (Untergang), it shields the year, the course of the sun [Jahr, march (ier, ienai, gehen), translates race or course of sun]
S.linkedContent: the becoming-crepuscular (Dämmerung) is not a decline (Untergang), it shields the year, the course of the sun [Jahr, march (ier, ienai, gehen), translates race or course of sun]

SH.content: example offers its example only on condition it holds for no other > every poem has its [irreplaceable] “January 20<sup><small>th</small></sup>”
SH.linkedContent: example offers its example only on condition it holds for no other > every poem has its [irreplaceable] “January 20th”

SH.content: what happens to the poem: the date > the poem is “dated,” calls itself back to the date, but it speaks! to all the others who haven’t experienced/shared singularity thus dated
SH.linkedContent: what happens to the poem: the date > the poem is “dated,” calls itself back to the date, but it speaks! to all the others who haven’t experienced/shared singularity thus dated

SH.content: instead of walling up in singularity > a date gives chance to speak to the other
SH.linkedContent: instead of walling up in singularity > a date gives chance to speak to the other

SH.content: writing on a certain date as a writing to (à) the date (past or future) [“to” of “to-come”]
SH.linkedContent: writing on a certain date as a writing to (à) the date (past or future) [“to” of “to-come”]

SH.content: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself
SH.linkedContent: poem is due its date, owes itself to its date as inmost concern, signature, owes itself to its secret, speaks of this date only insofar as it acquits itself

SH.content: to speak of the date one must also efface it, make it readable, an effacement faced w/ another date—the one to which it speaks > experience of date, experience itself?
SH.linkedContent: to speak of the date one must also efface it, make it readable, an effacement faced w/ another date—the one to which it speaks > experience of date, experience itself?

SH.content: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event
SH.linkedContent: “Geheimnis der Begegnung (the secrecy of encounter)” > otherness & solitude (poem, singularity) conjoined in one & same date: chance, plus d’un at once, that which seals event

SH.content: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer
SH.linkedContent: several singular events concentrated in same date, this concentration (Konzentration) a terrible word for memory, but also the gathering of soul, Kafka’s attention of prayer

SH.content: meridian binds (“das Verbindende,” both binds and connects), provokes, at noon, the encounter [shortest shadow], example of law > “a date would be the gnomon [nom, shadow, not mine] of these meridians”
SH.linkedContent: meridian binds (“das Verbindende,” both binds and connects), provokes, at noon, the encounter [shortest shadow], example of law > “a date would be the gnomon [nom, shadow, not mine] of these meridians”

SH.content: dating amounts to signing; signature marks provenance of what is given (sent), destined (whether or not it arrives) > one signs a date from a given place
SH.linkedContent: dating amounts to signing; signature marks provenance of what is given (sent), destined (whether or not it arrives) > one signs a date from a given place

SH.content: question “what is…[a date]?” is finite, signed, engaged, by a place, time, language(s)
SH.linkedContent: question “what is…[a date]?” is finite, signed, engaged, by a place, time, language(s)

SH.content: date repeats its unrepeatability: divides in repeating, enciphers, encrypts itself, effaces to become readable, unreadable in its readability
SH.linkedContent: date repeats its unrepeatability: divides in repeating, enciphers, encrypts itself, effaces to become readable, unreadable in its readability

SH.content: date always bound up w/ a proper name > gives us to think an idiom, each time, barely translatable [Derrida is also referring to his French phrasing]
SH.linkedContent: date always bound up w/ a proper name > gives us to think an idiom, each time, barely translatable [Derrida is also referring to his French phrasing]

SH.content: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist
SH.linkedContent: date not there, w/ draws in order to appear, there are dates (just like there are ashes), even if they don’t exist

SH.content: witnessing codes, disguises of poem at once essential & inessential [re: Szondi as intimate witness of one of Celan’s poems, he knew Celan passed through Berlin at this date], poem would speak to us nonetheless, beyond its dated singularity
SH.linkedContent: witnessing codes, disguises of poem at once essential & inessential [re: Szondi as intimate witness of one of Celan’s poems, he knew Celan passed through Berlin at this date], poem would speak to us nonetheless, beyond its dated singularity

SH.content: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well
SH.linkedContent: from Heidegger, datum becomes donation, thus date & gift, debt as well

SH.content: Heidegger: pre-calendrical datability
SH.linkedContent: Heidegger: pre-calendrical datability

SH.content: date: cut or incision poem bears in its body like a memory
SH.linkedContent: date: cut or incision poem bears in its body like a memory

SH.content: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us
SH.linkedContent: readability effaces the date, the very thing which it offers for reading, date must conceal w/in itself stigma of singularity if it is to last longer (lasting is the poem), only chance of spectral return, commemoration of date’s annihilation, kind of nothing or ash > ash awaits us

SH.content: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating
SH.linkedContent: annulment in the annulation of return belongs to movement of dating

SH.content: date is always also metonymy (part of event standing for whole)
SH.linkedContent: date is always also metonymy (part of event standing for whole)

SH.content: date resembles shibboleth, gives ciphered access to secret configuration of places for memory
SH.linkedContent: date resembles shibboleth, gives ciphered access to secret configuration of places for memory

SH.content: date is a future anterior, the slightest indetermination increases the chances (of a future anterior), gives time one assigns to anniversaries to come
SH.linkedContent: date is a future anterior, the slightest indetermination increases the chances (of a future anterior), gives time one assigns to anniversaries to come

SH.content: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date
SH.linkedContent: signature not only recalls the vanished as vanished, the singular event, its ash > it gathers together a conjunction of singularities, a partaking in future of same date

SH.content: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness
SH.linkedContent: date is a witness, but one can bless date w/out knowing to “what” or for “whom” one bears witness, always possible there’ll no longer be a witness for this witness

SH.content: affinity btwn date, name, ash
SH.linkedContent: affinity btwn date, name, ash

SH.content: ring’s condition & fate of all archival recording > date marks itself, becomes readable, by freeing itself from singularity it recalls, its body becomes ideal, coded
SH.linkedContent: ring’s condition & fate of all archival recording > date marks itself, becomes readable, by freeing itself from singularity it recalls, its body becomes ideal, coded

SH.content: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution
SH.linkedContent: ideality carries forgetting in its memory, the memory of forgetting itself, the truth of forgetting > reference to singular event annulled in ring’s annulation, the date’s turning-about, una volta, volte-face, revolt, revolution

SH.content: date offers itself up to annihilation, commemorating what may always be forgotten in absence of witness > date is threatened in remaining to be read
SH.linkedContent: date offers itself up to annihilation, commemorating what may always be forgotten in absence of witness > date is threatened in remaining to be read

SH.content: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash
SH.linkedContent: date may always become no one’s, nothing’s date, the essence w/out essence of ash

SH.content: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability ——mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)
SH.linkedContent: name partakes in this destiny of ash along w/ date, not empirical, is part of its readability ——mourning: reading itself > readability: tribute of lost singularity (“beauty” pays)

SH.content: date is mad, always more or less than what it says it is, we are mad for dates, those ashes which dates are, remains w/out being > music, Sichelschrift
SH.linkedContent: date is mad, always more or less than what it says it is, we are mad for dates, those ashes which dates are, remains w/out being > music, Sichelschrift

SH.content: date opens into madness, what there is to read, injunction in every reading; madness slumbers in aleatory encounter > chance among heterogeneities which break into making sense [re: Wahnsinn, Wahn/wann]
SH.linkedContent: date opens into madness, what there is to read, injunction in every reading; madness slumbers in aleatory encounter > chance among heterogeneities which break into making sense [re: Wahnsinn, Wahn/wann]

SH.content: given of date leaves its trace in the poem, the trace of the date is the poem
SH.linkedContent: given of date leaves its trace in the poem, the trace of the date is the poem

SH.content: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself
SH.linkedContent: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself

SH.content: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being
SH.linkedContent: a date, to become what it is, must give itself to be read in ash, in the nonbeing of its being

SH.content: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic > condition [of poem] made up of distress, hope, shi[f]t of tones, “Weschsel der Töne” [Hölderlin]
SH.linkedContent: gift of the poem, and of the date: no dialectic > condition [of poem] made up of distress, hope, shi[f]t of tones, “Weschsel der Töne” [Hölderlin]

SH.content: experience of ashes w/in incineration of date > date as incineration
SH.linkedContent: experience of ashes w/in incineration of date > date as incineration

SH.content: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash
SH.linkedContent: poem’s desire or gift, the date is born, in movement of blessing, toward ash

SH.content: date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance
SH.linkedContent: date consumed from w/in, the expiring that is its production, genesis, inscription: its essence & chance

SH.content: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”
SH.linkedContent: there is a holocaust (all-consuming) for every date: “every hour counts its holocaust”

SH.content: virtually at the same date because the originary date, as coded mark, is already a kind of fiction, singularity spoken of in generalities and fable of conventions (iterable marks)
SH.linkedContent: virtually at the same date because the originary date, as coded mark, is already a kind of fiction, singularity spoken of in generalities and fable of conventions (iterable marks)

SH.content: no “absolute poem,” but date (beyond calendar/clocks), madness of “when,” unthinkable Einmal (once), terrifying ambiguity of shibboleth > sign of belonging (alliance), threat of discrimination (war)
SH.linkedContent: no “absolute poem,” but date (beyond calendar/clocks), madness of “when,” unthinkable Einmal (once), terrifying ambiguity of shibboleth > sign of belonging (alliance), threat of discrimination (war)

SH.content: a date “may give rise to calculations,” but it ceases to be calculable
SH.linkedContent: a date “may give rise to calculations,” but it ceases to be calculable

SH.content: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)
SH.linkedContent: a date fascinates, but is not made to fascinate, crypt occurs wherever singular incision marks language (not the work of hermetic poet anxious to seduce w/ ciphers)

SH.content: wherever signature enters idiom, leaving trace of incision (unique & iterable, cryptic & readable), there’s a date
SH.linkedContent: wherever signature enters idiom, leaving trace of incision (unique & iterable, cryptic & readable), there’s a date

SH.content: effacement of date or name inside the ring: origin of philosophy, hermeneutics, poetics, their sendoff [envois]
SH.linkedContent: effacement of date or name inside the ring: origin of philosophy, hermeneutics, poetics, their sendoff [envois]

SH.content: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher
SH.linkedContent: no worse loss than death of name (still, a date remains) > mourning, interiorization of other in Erinnerung, the preserving of other in sepulcher/epitaph, is denied us; words incinerated beyond sepulcher can return as ghosts > incinerated beyond of date, words lost w/out sepulcher

SH.content: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]
SH.linkedContent: how can German language receiver circumcision of poem’s date following the holocaust, the solution, the ash of all? how can you bless these ashes in German? [re: Celan]

SH.content: circumcision of word is not dated in history, has no age, but calls forth date, opens word to other, of all that calls itself (the name, blessing of name, yes & no) > it sets turning the ring
SH.linkedContent: circumcision of word is not dated in history, has no age, but calls forth date, opens word to other, of all that calls itself (the name, blessing of name, yes & no) > it sets turning the ring

SH.content: [Derrida ends his lecture by dating it, circumcising]
SH.linkedContent: [Derrida ends his lecture by dating it, circumcising]

DS.content: Mallarmé: as of this date, a veil
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: as of this date, a veil

SP.content: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance
SP.linkedContent: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance

OTO.content: TN. data littera, “letter given,” first words of medieval formula for time and place of legal act
OTO.linkedContent: TN. data littera, “letter given,” first words of medieval formula for time and place of legal act

SW.content: diminish the infinite, diminish ad infinitum: that’s the temptation/dream since ever: but you’re doing it w/out being sure of textile to come, as if caught in sails (voiles) & pushed toward unknown, at the point of this extremity, as if someone were awaiting new Messiah, i.e. a “happy event”—nicknamed the verdict > yes, but a verdict w/out truth, w/ a due date no longer caught up in revealing a truth, the fold or unfolding of a veil—writing from distant place of as if
SW.linkedContent: diminish the infinite, diminish ad infinitum: that’s the temptation/dream since ever: but you’re doing it w/out being sure of textile to come, as if caught in sails (voiles) & pushed toward unknown, at the point of this extremity, as if someone were awaiting new Messiah, i.e. a “happy event”—nicknamed the verdict > yes, but a verdict w/out truth, w/ a due date no longer caught up in revealing a truth, the fold or unfolding of a veil—writing from distant place of as if

SW.content: infinite finite trial (implacable suspicion) that you impose on yourself to not want what you know you want (the due date of such a verdict)?
SW.linkedContent: infinite finite trial (implacable suspicion) that you impose on yourself to not want what you know you want (the due date of such a verdict)?

SW.content: tallith as trace of date, event of singularity, not lifting, unfolding of veil—“even if one translates this gift of the Law as Revelation, the figure of the veil,” the taking-place of the event counts more than the “intuition & movement of vision”
SW.linkedContent: tallith as trace of date, event of singularity, not lifting, unfolding of veil—“even if one translates this gift of the Law as Revelation, the figure of the veil,” the taking-place of the event counts more than the “intuition & movement of vision”

SW.content: bookmark the fringes, they served once to accomplish a commandment, may another be accomplished w/ them [Kitsour…] > that’s what I’m doing, à contretemps, et signe et livre et date
SW.linkedContent: bookmark the fringes, they served once to accomplish a commandment, may another be accomplished w/ them [Kitsour…] > that’s what I’m doing, à contretemps, et signe et livre et date

DPi.content: in POOF, I attempted, let’s say, to “deconstruct” Schmitt—the sovereign—this a-legal position > inaugural, founding act of constitution (suspended from & at the constitution [à la constitution]) > on the date
DPi.linkedContent: in POOF, I attempted, let’s say, to “deconstruct” Schmitt—the sovereign—this a-legal position > inaugural, founding act of constitution (suspended from & at the constitution [à la constitution]) > on the date

DPi.content: condemned to death: know the date, quasi-suicidal mastery of death, criminals who do everything to give themselves this death (se donner cette mort) > phantasm of omnipotence over their own death
DPi.linkedContent: condemned to death: know the date, quasi-suicidal mastery of death, criminals who do everything to give themselves this death (se donner cette mort) > phantasm of omnipotence over their own death

DPi.content: modality “when” splits condemned to die (mortal who doesn’t know moment of death) from condemned to death [DP] like a blade
DPi.linkedContent: modality “when” splits condemned to die (mortal who doesn’t know moment of death) from condemned to death [DP] like a blade

DPi.content: w/ DP, the third party, the State, its legal system are presumed to know, calculate, operate “time of death”: alignment of objective time w/ subjective time of subject condemned to death
DPi.linkedContent: w/ DP, the third party, the State, its legal system are presumed to know, calculate, operate “time of death”: alignment of objective time w/ subjective time of subject condemned to death

DPi.content: it belongs to life not to be immortal, but also to have a future where instant of death is not calculable
DPi.linkedContent: it belongs to life not to be immortal, but also to have a future where instant of death is not calculable

DPi.content: to be against DP is to be against calculation, calculable decidability of you will die on such and such a day, at such and such an hour > no future w/ anticipation of calculable instant > “my life” must keep a relation to the coming of the other as coming of the to-come (venue de l’à-venir)
DPi.linkedContent: to be against DP is to be against calculation, calculable decidability of you will die on such and such a day, at such and such an hour > no future w/ anticipation of calculable instant > “my life” must keep a relation to the coming of the other as coming of the to-come (venue de l’à-venir)

DPi.content: DP ends finitude of “my life” > w/ calendar

C.content: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart
C.linkedContent: date as place of crypt, stands in for it, only one that remains; why do I date? throw of a die: no one will know what was lived on the date (what was taken away), save (fors) the heart

TN.content: On Touching—Jean-Luc Nancy is intentionally dated, get you to read him
TN.linkedContent: On Touching—Jean-Luc Nancy is intentionally dated, get you to read him

BSi.content: [vis-à-vis Celan] January 20th [date Hitler drew up plans for ‘final solution’]—anniversary of death > sovereign decision to commit genocide
BSi.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Celan] January 20th [date Hitler drew up plans for ‘final solution’]—anniversary of death > sovereign decision to commit genocide

BSi.content: exergue (ex-ergon)—like parergon, out of work that puts to work > but like capital too: makes work happen, comes at head (inscribe date)
BSi.linkedContent: exergue (ex-ergon)—like parergon, out of work that puts to work > but like capital too: makes work happen, comes at head (inscribe date)

BSi.content: Celan: are we not all descended from such dates [January 20th]?
BSi.linkedContent: Celan: are we not all descended from such dates [January 20th]?

CIR.content: on each date, a drop of blood, one date enough to leave geologic program behind
CIR.linkedContent: on each date, a drop of blood, one date enough to leave geologic program behind

EU.content: question of droit du droit not juridical, event of foundation never comprehended w/in logic it founds > foundation of a university not a university event (only the anniversary of the foundation would be), foundation of reason isn’t legal, isn’t rational: only w/in epoch of law can one distinguish btwn legal/illegal conflicts
EU.linkedContent: question of droit du droit not juridical, event of foundation never comprehended w/in logic it founds > foundation of a university not a university event (only the anniversary of the foundation would be), foundation of reason isn’t legal, isn’t rational: only w/in epoch of law can one distinguish btwn legal/illegal conflicts

EU.content: a (philosophical) letter dates the “as if” of the mood, a fabled mood, “a once upon a time, one day, I had the feeling…”
EU.linkedContent: a (philosophical) letter dates the “as if” of the mood, a fabled mood, “a once upon a time, one day, I had the feeling…”
